vague_description: Ben needs to decide how many acres of apples and pears to plant in his orchard to maximize profit while adhering to growth and labor constraints.
detailed_description: Ben is growing apples and pears on his orchard. He has \var{TotalAcres} acres available on which he must grow a minimum of \var{MinApples} acres of apples and a minimum of \var{MinPears} acres of pears to meet demands. The profit per acre of apple is \$\var{ProfitApple} and the profit per acre of pear is \$\var{ProfitPear}. He prefers to grow more pears than apples but limitations in his workforce allow him to grow at most \var{MaxPearsToApplesRatio} times the amount of pears as apples. How many of each fruit should Ben grow in order to maximize his profit? What is that profit?
target_objective: Ben wants to maximize his profit
target_constraints: Number of apple acres is an integer
Number of pear acres is an integer
Number of apple acres is non-negative
Number of pear acres is non-negative
Number of apple acres is at least MinApples
Number of pear acres is at least MinPears
The number of pear acres is at most MaxPearsToApplesRatio times the number of apple acres
The sum of apple acres and pear acres does not exceed TotalAcres
target_parameters: Total acres available for growing fruits
Minimum acres of apples that must be grown
Minimum acres of pears that must be grown
Profit per acre of growing apples
Profit per acre of growing pears
Maximum ratio of pears to apples in growing
